title: Pedrosa triumphs in Japan
text:
Source: Shanghai Daily | October 12, 2015, Monday | Print Edition 
Dani Pedrosa won the Japanese Grand Prix yesterday while MotoGP championship leader Valentino Rossi extended his lead in the standings with a second-place finish. 
Repsol Honda rider Pedrosa came from sixth on the grid and crossed the finish line with an 8.573-second lead over Yamaha rider Rossi. Rossiâ€™s Yamaha teammate Jorge Lorenzo was third. With three races left, Rossi now has 283 points for an 18-point lead over Lorenzo. Defending world champion Marc Marquez of Honda is a distant third with 197 points.
